title: My Personal Webpage
text: I‚Äôm a second year Computer Science and Engineering student doing minor in Computational Mathematics with a passion for pushing the boundaries of knowledge in AI. With a strong background in Computer Science, my research focuses on Practive Oriented AI, aiming to contribute to meaningful advancements and solutions.

title: My Personal Webpage
text:
Welcome to my personal page! I thrive on solving complex problems and love turning innovative ideas into reality. Whether I‚Äôm coding, designing, or exploring new fields, I bring dedication and curiosity to everything I do. Outside of work, I enjoy hiking, reading science fiction, and experimenting with new recipes. Here, you‚Äôll find insights into my projects, interests, and the journey I‚Äôm on to make a positive impact in the world. Thank you for visiting, and I hope you find something that inspires you!
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: A sample work
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure¬†1.


Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()








Figure¬†1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: Come and eat something new
text: Ingredients: For Marination: 1 kg chicken (preferably with bones) 1 cup yogurt 1.5 tsp red chili powder 1 tsp turmeric powder 2 tbsp ginger garlic paste 1 tsp garam masala powder Salt to taste 2 tbsp lemon juice For Rice: 2 cups basmati rice 4 cups water 1 bay leaf 4 cloves 2 cardamom pods 1 cinnamon stick Salt to taste For Biryani: 2 large onions, thinly sliced 1/2 cup ghee or oil 1/4 cup milk A pinch of saffron Fresh coriander and mint leaves, chopped 2 green chilies, slit Instructions: Marinate the Chicken: In a large bowl, mix yogurt, red chili powder, turmeric powder, ginger garlic paste, garam masala powder, salt, and lemon juice. Add the chicken pieces and coat them well with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight. Prepare the Rice: Wash the basmati rice thoroughly and soak it in water for 30 minutes. In a large pot, bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add bay leaf, cloves, cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, and salt. Add the soaked rice and cook until it‚Äôs 70% done. Drain the rice and set aside. Fry the Onions: Heat ghee or oil in a large pan. Add the sliced onions and fry until they are golden brown and crispy. Remove and set aside. Layer the Biryani: In a heavy-bottomed pot, spread a layer of marinated chicken at the bottom. Add a layer of partially cooked rice over the chicken. Sprinkle fried onions, chopped coriander, mint leaves, and slit green chilies. Repeat the layers until all the chicken and rice are used up. Soak saffron in warm milk and drizzle it over the top layer of rice. Dum Cooking: Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid. You can seal the edges with dough to trap the steam inside. Cook on low heat for about 30-40 minutes until the chicken is fully cooked and the rice is tender. Serve: Gently fluff up the biryani with a fork, ensuring the layers remain intact. Serve hot with raita or your favorite side dish. Enjoy your flavorful and aromatic Hyderabadi Chicken Biryani! üçõ
